com.samskivert.depot

Interface CacheAdapter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EHCacheAdapter

    public interface CacheAdapter
    Implementations of this interface are responsible for all the caching needs of Depot. From the point of view of this interface, there are a potentially very large number of caches available, each idenfided by a unique cacheId. Currently Depot creates up to three caches for each record type: Any record type with a primary key has a CacheAdapter.CacheCategory.RECORD cache, for storing record instances by primary key. Record types with primary keys may also have a CacheAdapter.CacheCategory.SHORT_KEYSET cache wherein KeySet instances are stored, identified by query strings. See FindAllQuery for more on this. Finally, clients may request CacheAdapter.CacheCategory.RESULT caching of entire result sets of some record type -- which does not need to have a primary key, in contrast to the other two categories. These are also identified by query strings, and end up in a third cache.

      static class  CacheAdapter.CacheCategory 
      static interface  CacheAdapter.CachedValue<T>
      The encapsulated result of a cache lookup.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear(String cacheId, boolean localOnly)
      Clears the cache with the specified name.
      <T> Iterable<Serializable> enumerate(String cacheId)
      Provides a way to enumerate the currently cached entries for the given cache.
      <T> CacheAdapter.CachedValue<T> lookup(String cacheId, Serializable key)
      Searches the given cache using the given key and returns the resulting CacheAdapter.CachedValue, or null if nothing exists in the cache for this key.
      void remove(String cacheId, Serializable key)
      Removes the cache entry, if any, associated with the given key.
      void shutdown()
      Shut down all operations, e.g.
      <T> void store(CacheAdapter.CacheCategory category, String cacheId, Serializable key, T value)
      Stores a new value in the given cache under the given key.

      • clear

        void clear(String cacheId,
           boolean localOnly)
        Clears the cache with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        localOnly - if true, only clear the cache on the local node, do not broadcast instructions for all distributed nodes to clear this cache as well.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shut down all operations, e.g. persisting memory contents to disk.
